fieldData.title: Bridging subsidy Corona for self-employed with a disability
fieldData.title_nationalLanguage: Überbrückungszuschuss Corona für Selbstständige mit Behinderung
fieldData.calc_subMinorCategory: Extensions of  income support to workers not covered by any kind of protection scheme
fieldData.descriptionBackgroundInfo: Self-employed people with a disability have been entitled to a specific "bridging subsidy" in the amount of €267 per month (equalisation tax, amount for 2020), long before the Corona crisis hit the country. This support is available to self-employed people with a degree of disability of at least 50%.
fieldData.descriptionContentOfMeasure: The subsidy applies to disabled persons who are either self-employed in companies with a maximum of five employees at the time of application or are mainly active themselves (sole proprietors) and who can demonstrate a disability-related additional expenditure, which represents a significant burden for entrepreneurial activity.In the face of the COVID-19 crisis, the subsidy was slightly amended: The need to demonstrate the need for the subsidy due to disability-related expenses has been omitted. The bridging subsidy is available to disabled persons whose employment is threatened by the Corona pandemic, even without proof of disability needs. This applies to applications submitted until 30 June 2020 for a period of three months. The amount received per month is at €267.
fieldData.descriptionInvolvementOfSocialPartners: The social partners' involvement is unknown.
fieldData.statusOfRegulation: New aspects included into existing measure
